episode_title: 215 - The One Where Rachel and Ross… You Know

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s apartment. Joey and Chandler enter with Chandler covering his eyes and Joey leading him.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Alright, no peeking. No peeking, no peeking, no peeking.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Alright, alright, but you better be wearing clothes when I open my eyes.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Alright open your eyes. [opens his eyes to see two black leather recliners and a big screen TV]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sweet mother of all that is good and pure.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Huh? Days of our Lives picked up my option.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Congratulations!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Now we can finally watch Green Acres the way it was meant to be seen.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So uh, which one is mine?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whichever one you want, man. Whichever one you want. [Chandler starts to sit in one of the chairs] Not that one.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: [sits down] Ohh yes.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: [sits down] Ohh yeah, that’s the stuff.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: [reaches for the footrest lever] Do we dare?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: We dare.

content.speaker: Both
content.text: [both extend the footrests] Aaahhhh. [both recline their chairs] AAAAHHHHHH.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s apartment. Chandler and Joey are sitting in their recliners watching TV. Monica, Ross, and Phoebe are there.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can’t believe two cows made the ultimate sacrifice so you guys could watch TV with your feet up.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well they were chair-shaped cows. They never would have survived in the wild.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: This screen is amazing, I mean Dick Van Dyke is practically life-size.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Woah!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rose Marie really belongs on a smaller screen, doesn’t she?
[Rachel enters]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi you guys.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey you. [they stand together in front of the TV.]

content.speaker: Chandler & Joey
content.text: Woah, hey, yo. [Rachel and Ross move]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So, uh, how was your day?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh you know, pretty much the usual, uh, sun shining, birds chirping.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really? Mine too.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey cool, mine too.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: [beeper goes off] Yeah, yeah, yeah. I got to get to the museum. So um, I’ll see you tonight.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: OK. [they go to kiss but everyone’s watching so Ross just kisses her on the top of her head and leaves]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Bye guys.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Bye.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: [walks up to Rachel in front of the TV] Tonight?

content.speaker: Chandler & Joey
content.text: Hey, yo. [they move from out of in front of the TV]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’s tonight?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It is our first official date. Our first date.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh, hello.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Tonight you’re supposed to waitress for me, my catering thing, any of those words trigger anything for you?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: God, oh God Monica, I forgot. This is our first date.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes but my mom got me this job.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK, I can be a waitress, I can be a waitress.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, thank you, thank you, thank you, thank you. See Phoebe, Phoebe.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really Phoebs? Because, you know, you’d have to be an actual waitress. This can’t be like your ‘I can be a bear cub’ thing.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I can be a waitress. OK watch this. Um, gimme two number ones, 86 the bacon, one Adam and Eve on a raft and rick’em, la-la-la-la-la, la-la-la-la-la.

content.description: Dr. Burke’s apartment. Dr. Burke answers the door for Phoebe and Monica.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s James Bond.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sorry we’re late.

content.speaker: Dr. Burke
content.text: Ah, that’s OK, come on in. Um, I’m sorry, is Monica Geller coming? I was told she was.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Dr. Burke, it, it’s me.

content.speaker: Dr. Burke
content.text: Monica? My God you used to be so… I mean you, you, you, you must have lost like… You look great.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thank you. This is my friend Phoebe. She’s gonna be helping me tonight.

content.speaker: Dr. Burke
content.text: Hi Phoebe, nice to meet you. [Phoebe just giggles when they shake] So, how ya been?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’ve been great, just great. How have you been? [tilting her head]

content.speaker: Dr. Burke
content.text: Oh, well obviously you know Barbara and I split up, otherwise you wouldn’t have done the head tilt.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: The head tilt?

content.speaker: Dr. Burke
content.text: Yeah, since the divorce, when anybody asks me how I am, it’s always with a sympathetic head tilt. [demonstrating] ‘How ya doin’? You OK?’

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Dr. Burke
content.text: No no, it, it’s fine, believe me. I do it too. I always answer with the ‘I’m OK’ head bob. [demonstrates] ‘I’m OK.’ [tilts head] ‘You sure?’ [bobs head] ‘Yeah, I’m fine.’ Hey listen, I’ve got to set up the music. I got a new CD changer, of course the divorce only left me with 4 CD’s to change.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: [her and Phoebe tilt their heads] Oh, that’s too bad.

content.speaker: Dr. Burke
content.text: [bobbing his head] I’ll survive.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s apartment. They’re still in their chairs watching TV. Chandler is ordering a pizza.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh, two larges, extra cheese on both. But listen, don’t ring the buzzer for 19, ring 20, Geller-Green, they’ll let you in, OK. If you buzz our door, there’s no tip for you. OK, thanks. Pizza’s on the way. I told you we wouldn’t have to get up.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What if we have to pee?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’ll cancel the sodas.

content.description: Dr. Burke’s apartment. Monica and Dr. Burke are in the kitchen.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’ve got to get back out there, it’s your party.

content.speaker: Dr. Burke
content.text: But they’re so dull, they’re all opthamologists.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re an opthamologist.

content.speaker: Dr. Burke
content.text: Only because my parents wanted me to be, I wanted to be a sherrif.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: [entering the kitchen from the party] That’s funny, no. Cadillac, cataract, I get it, no I get it, you stay out there.

content.speaker: Dr. Burke
content.text: See.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Alright, I’ll tell you what. I’ll come get you in 5 minutes with some sort of um, kabob emergency.

content.speaker: Dr. Burke
content.text: OK. You better. Oh God, here we go. Hey wanna see ’em go nuts? Watch this. [grabbing some wine glasses and opening the door to the party] Who needs glasses? [everyone laughs]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You are so smitten.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I am not.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, you are so much the smitten kitten. You should ask him out.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Dr. Burke? I don’t think so. I mean, like, he’s a grown up.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So. You two are totally into each other.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, he’s a friend of my parents. He’s like 20 years older than me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK, so what, you’re just never gonna see him again?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Not never. I mean, I’m gonna see him tomorrow at my eye appointment.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Didn’t you like, just get your eyes checked?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well yeah, but, you know, uh, 27 is a dangerous eye age.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Ross and Rachel are returning from a movie.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: C’mon, I’m not saying it was a bad movie, I’m just saying, you know, it was a little… hard to follow.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I told you there was going to be sub-titles.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know, I just didn’t want to wear my glasses on my first date.
[They start kissing.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It would really help when I’m kissing you if you didn’t shout out my sister’s name.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey, I’m just checking.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Mon.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Mon.
[Since they’re alone they start kissing and Ross’s hands work their way down until they’re on Rachel’s butt. Rachel starts laughing.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What, what.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m sorry. Oh God, I’m sorry, it’s just that when you moved your hands down to my butt, it was like woah, Ross’s hands are on my butt. Sorry.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And that’s, that’s funny why?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well it’s not, honey I’m sorry, I guess I’m just nervous. I mean, it’s you, ya know, it’s us. I mean, we’re crossing that line, sort of a big thing.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I, I know it’s big, I just didn’t know it was uh, ha-ha big.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: OK. [start kissing again and Rachel starts lauging again]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: OK, my hands were no where near your butt.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know, I know, I know, I know. I was just thinking about when they were there the last time, I’m sorry. I’m sorry, I’m sorry. OK, OK, look, woah, I promise, I’m good, I’m not gonna laugh anymore. OK put your hands back there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No see now, now I can’t because uh, I’m feeling too self conscious.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Just one cheek.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nuh, uh, the moment’s gone.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Alright, just put your hands out and I’ll back up into them.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s romantic.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: C’mon touch it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, come on squeeze it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Rub it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, come on, would you just grab my ass.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s apartment. They are watching a Miracle Wax info-mercial.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow, look at that. The car is on fire, yet somehow it’s expensive paint job is protected by the Miracle Wax.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You got a Cheeto on your face man.[Joey removes the Cheeto and eats it]
[Ross enters]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Chandler & Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What’re you doin’ here? Aren’t you supposed to be out with Rachel?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That was 14 hours ago.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So how’d it go?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh. Listen, have you ever been uh, you know, foolin’ around with a girl and uh, she started laughin’?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, but uh, it was 1982 and my flock of seagulls haircut was tickling her chin.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: She laughed at you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. I don’t know, I’ve been wanting this since like ninth grade typing, ya know. And I just want it to be perfect and right and… why isn’t that laser beam cutting through the paint?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s the Miracle Wax.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It certainly is a miracle.
[Rachel enters]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi you guys.

content.speaker: Chandler & Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi. Listen, I was um, thinkin’ about…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Listen can you guys uh, speak up, it’s harder for us to hear you when you lower your voice.
[Rachel and Ross go out in the hall]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: OK, listen, I’m sorry about last night and I really want to make it up to you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, you, ya know there’s no need to make it u… how?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I was thinking maybe a um, a romantic dinner with um, candles and wine and then uh, maybe going back to my place for um, dessert.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Humm, that sounds, I don’t, perfect.
[there’s a loud bang at the door so Ross opens it back up to find a shoe has been thrown at it]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What’s this.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Could you get us a couple of beers?

content.description: Dr. Burke’s office. Monica is there for her eye appointment.

content.speaker: Dr. Burke
content.text: I’m going to look into your eyes now.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really.

content.speaker: Dr. Burke
content.text: Yeah, that’s my job. Alright, look up… look down, now open your eyes, now look down. That’s right, look into the light. Now look at me… OK. Your eyes look good. Those are good eyes.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Good, they feel good, in my head.

content.speaker: Dr. Burke
content.text: So, it’s great to see ya.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You too.

content.speaker: Dr. Burke
content.text: You too.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: OK, um. Goodbye.

content.speaker: Dr. Burke
content.text: Drops!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Dr. Burke
content.text: Drops. Here, they’re free.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thanks. So, I guess I better be going.

content.speaker: Dr. Burke
content.text: Oh, OK, yeah. I’ll see ya later.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thanks again.
[He kisses her on the cheek, she returns the kiss, then they embrace in a full on kiss]

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s apartment. They’re still watching TV. Phoebe stands in front of the TV.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: We have got to get you lazy boys out of these chairs.

content.speaker: Chandler & Joey
content.text: Hey, woah, hey, woah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You know you should go outside and be with the three-dimensional people.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, inside good, outside bad.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You guys are so pathetic, I, oh, OH, XANADU! OH.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: She’s one of us now.
[Rachel and Ross enter]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi you guys.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler, Joey & Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well we just wanted to stop by and uh, say goodnight.

content.speaker: Chandler, Joey & Phoebe
content.text: Goodnight.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look at that, they won’t even turn their heads.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Alright you guys, I’m takin’ off my shirt.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: [uses a dentist mirror to see] Naa, she’s lyin’.
[Monica enters carrying food that’s been delivered]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Stop sending food to our apartment.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, why’re you all dressed up?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You’re not the only one who has a date tonight.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? You have a date? Who with?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No one.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: C’mon, what’s his name?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nothing.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on, tell me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Alright, but I’m very excited about this OK, so you gotta promise you won’t get all big-brothery and judgmental.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, I promise, what.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s Richard Burke.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Who’s Richard Burke? Doc, Doctor Burke? You have a date with Doctor Burke? Why, why, why should that bother me? I, I love that man, he’s like a uh, brother to dad.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well for your information he happens to be one of the brightest, most sophisticated, sexiest men I’ve ever been with.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Doctor Burke is sexy?

content.speaker: Rachel & Phoebe
content.text: Oh God, absolutely.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: [his beeper goes off] It’s the museum again, can I, oh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ya know, Dr. Burke kissed me once.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: When?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: When I was um, 7, I crashed my bike right out in front of his house and to stop me from crying he kissed me right here. [points to the tip of her nose]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh you are so lucky.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: [on the phone] Woah, woah, woah australopithicus isn’t supposed to be in that display. No. No. No, n, homo-habilus was erect, australopithicus was never fully erect.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well maybe he was nervous.

content.description: Museum of Natural History. Ross is fixing a display, Rachel is waiting patiently.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh look, I can’t believe this. Look, homo-habilus hasn’t even learned how to use tools yet and they’ve got him here wi, with clay pots. Why don’t, why don’t they just give him a microwave? I’m sorry, I’m sorry this is taking so long, ya know, I, I, it’s just it’s longer than I expected, we will have dinner.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s OK, it’s fine.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: KARL!
[Ross leaves to find Karl. Rachel takes a peek under the loincloth of one of the display models.]

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s apartment. Monica and Dr. Burke are sitting on the couch. He’s showing her the pictures in his wallet.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow, is that Michelle?

content.speaker: Dr. Burke
content.text: Yep.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’ve not seen her since high school graduation. Oh my God, that night she got so dru… motional.

content.speaker: Dr. Burke
content.text: Ya know, she’s having another baby.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I thought she just had one.

content.speaker: Dr. Burke
content.text: No no. Henry’s almost two and he’s talking and everyting. Here. You know, the other day he told me he liked me better than his other grandpa. Now in all fairness his other grandpa’s a drunk but still…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, you’re a grandpa.

content.speaker: Dr. Burke
content.text: Yeah. Are we nuts here?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t know, maybe. I mean I’m dating a man who’s pool I once peed in.

content.speaker: Dr. Burke
content.text: I didn’t need to know that. I guess 21 years is a lot. I mean, hell, I’m a whole person who can drink older than you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Dr. Burke
content.text: So.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So maybe we should just…

content.speaker: Dr. Burke
content.text: Yeah, yeah, maybe.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow, this really sucks.

content.speaker: Dr. Burke
content.text: Yeah, it sure does. [they hug and it turns into a passionate kiss]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, we don’t really have to decide anything right now, do we?

content.speaker: Dr. Burke
content.text: No, no, there’s no rush or anything.
[knock at the door]

content.speaker: Delivery Guy
content.text: Pizza delivery.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, I’m gonna kill those guys.

content.description: Museum of Natural History. Ross enters the display where Rachel is waiting.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rach.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m done.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah well, you know what, so is uh, Sorentino’s.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wha, OK, I’m sorry, let’s uh, why don’t we find someplace else.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, you know what, it’s late, everything’s gonna be closed. Why don’t we just do it another night?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, we won’t.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We won’t?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: [grabs a fur pelt] C’mon.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: OK, that’s dead right?

content.description: The museum planetarium. Ross and Rachel enter on stage.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What is this? What are we doing?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Shh. Do you want cran-apple or cran-grape?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Grape.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: [spreads the pelt on the floor] OK, now, sit. OK. [he starts the music system]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, God.
[The stereo system booms out ‘Billions of years ago…’. Ross gets up and changes it to music.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sorry.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ah, so what are we looking at?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well uh, you see that, that little cluster of stars next to the big one? That is Ursa Major.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’ve no idea, could be. Listen, I’m sorry I had to work tonight.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh it’s OK. You were worth the wait, and I don’t just mean tonight. [they kiss]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re not laughing.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: This time it’s not so funny.
[They kiss and start undressing. As Rachel tries to pull off Ross’s tie she catches it in his mouth. Then they roll across the fur rug.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ah, oh God. Oh, honey, oh that’s OK.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What. Oh no, you just rolled over the juice box.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, thank God.

content.description: Museum of Natural History. The next morning Rachel and Ross are sleeping in the display under a fur.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi you. I can’t believe I’m waking up next to you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know it is pretty unbelievaaaaah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We’re not alone. [A church youth group is outside the display watching them]

content.description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey’s apartment. They are still in their chairs, watching Beavis and Butthead.]

content.text: [they’re laughing along with the show when an alarm goes off]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Is that the fire alarm?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah. [feels the floor] Oh it’s not warm yet, we still have time.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Cool.
